discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Preference 400 is prefered over 200

If you want to affect different preferences for those tlocs for each group of branch sites, you need two tloc lists, the east is already ok, the second one, for west must have higher pref on TLOC 100.100.100.100 like requested. Answer is A.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

comments.content: Option A and B are identical, except they have the preference numbers reversed in the West TLOC list. Option B has the wrong numbers. It has the West list configured identical to the East list, with the numbers that are only correct in the East list (with the .101 address having the preference of 400).

discussion.content:
I have completed this in a real life production for the public sector in the UK, and from real life designs being implemented from TLOC-list policy where two or more WAN transport locations are defined, when specifying the least preference, this route becomes the feasible route.

The Correct Answer is B

Reference:-
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/command/sdwan-cr-book/config-cmd.html#r_shaping_rate_3056.xml

Selected Answer: A
correct should be A 
TLOC 100.100.100.100 - primary for west, so west should have higher preference 400 over east tloc

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A customer wants to implement primary and secondary Cisco SD-WAN overlay routing for prefixes that are advertised for both data centers. The east data center (TLOC 101.101.101.101) is primary for east sites, and the west data center (TLOC 100.100.100.100) is primary for west sites. Which configuration change achieves this objective?

choices.C: The device sends a critical alarm of events to vManage.
choices.B: The device sends notifications to vSmart that sends them to vManage.
choices.D: The device sends a critical alarm to vSmart that sends it to vManage.
choices.A: The device sends event notifications to vManage.

questions.question_text: How is an event monitored and reported for an individual device in the overlay network at site ID:S4300T6E43F36?

An engineer must deploy a QoS policy with these requirements:

â€¢ policy name: App-police
â€¢ police rate: 1000000
â€¢ burst: 1000000
â€¢ exceed: drop

Which configuration meets the requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Deploy under interface

comments.content:
There is no "set" command under interface configuration:

site3-vedge01(config)# vpn 10
site3-vedge01(config-vpn-10)# interface ge0/0/0
site3-vedge01(config-interface-ge0/0/0)# set
 ^
% Invalid input detected at '^' marker.

And normally you would configure the policy on vSmart so B seems correct to me.

C. vBond is the correct answer
